text:
Astoria Park (Queens): the band shells at the southern end of the park, seen from 19th Street and Hoyt Avenue. The Triborough Bridge was later erected here, just to the right of the shell. View 2 was taken from the bridge looking west across Hell Gate toward Manhattan. View 3 shows the Astoria Park swimming pool, viewing inland from the bridge. On the left is the Hell Gate railroad bridge.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: March 14, 1931
Views 2,3: July 25, 1936
title: Queens: Astoria Park.

title: Queens: Astoria Park.

text:
Hell Gate Bridge, spanning the East River, viewing northeast-ward on 19th Street, Queens and across Astoria Park. View 1 is from near Hoyt Avenue; view 2 from near 24th Drive.

March 14, 1931
Views 1,2
View 3: June 24, 1987

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - Queens.

text:
Triborough Bridge: Two views of construction work at Hoyt Avenue and 19th Street, Astoria, Queens.

February 9, 1932
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - Queens.

text:
Triborough Bridge: Two views of construction work at Hoyt Avenue and 19th Street, Astoria, Queens.

February 9, 1932
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - Queens.

text:
(1)
Triboro Bridge, east from a point northwest of 19th Street in Astoria Park, showing the Approach to the bridge proper. In the
foreground partially seen is the anchorage.
June 12, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from 19th Street, showing on each side of the Approach
Hoyt Ave. North and Hoyt Avenue South.
June 12, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2 views, not dry mount items.)
title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - Queens approach.
